intro: Micrargeria, commonly known as the "tropical milkweed," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Apocynaceae family. These plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and are characterized by their showy, often pink or red flowers. Micrargeria species typically have opposite, simple leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. They are often used in gardens for their ornamental value and can serve as a host plant for certain butterfly species. Some species are also known for their medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
